text: ‘dayāl nitāi chaitanya’ ba’le nāch re āmār mana
nāch re āmār mana, nāch re āmār mana
translation: O my mind, dance! O my mind, dance! O my mind, dance, chanting, “Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya!”

text: (eman dayāl ta’ nāi he mār kheye prema dey)
translation: Oh! No one is so merciful! Nitāi endures being beaten yet gives His aggressors divine love.

Then my offences will go away and I will attain the wealth of divine love. (In the Names of Nitāi and Chaitanya, there is no consideration of offences.) Then I will develop taste for Kṛṣṇa’s Name and my bondage will be destroyed. (Then I will have loving attachment.)

text: (kṛṣṇa-rati vinā jīver jīvan to michhe he)
translation: Then easily the life of the soul will be successful. (Without attachment to Kṛṣṇa, a soul’s life is simply false.) Then, at the end of life, a soul will see Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Śyām in Vṛndāvan (if Śrī Gaura bestows His mercy).
